word_mean: 偏角，偏差，偏转：偏离正常垂直位置，如眼球围绕它的前后轴旋转，使其垂直子午线位于它本来位置的颞侧(正偏转)或鼻侧(负偏转)
赤道坐标系的纬向坐标，从天赤道沿过天球上一点的赤经圈量到该点的弧长。

sentence.Network_en: The paper analyzed the cause of the declination in a raise boring.
sentence.Network_cn: 这文章分析了天井钻进偏斜的原因。

sentence.Network_en: Scanning in declination may be achieved by tilting the aerial system.
sentence.Network_cn: 进行赤纬扫描时,可以把天线倾斜.

sentence.Network_en: Magnetic field, auroras, magnetic declination and magnetic field reversals.
sentence.Network_cn: 地球的磁场 、 极光 、 磁偏角和地磁极倒转.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin declinatio(n-), from the verb declinare (see decline)

means.word_mean: 1. a condition inferior to an earlier condition; a gradual falling off from a better state

2. (astronomy) the angular distance to a point on a celestial object measured north or south from the celestial equator; expressed in degrees; used with right ascension to specify positions on the celestial sphere
4. a polite refusal of an invitation

auth_sentence.content: This angle between the equator and the place on Earth where the Sun is straight above you is called the "solar declination".
auth_sentence.res_content: This angle between the equator and the place on Earth where the Sun is straight above you is called the "solar declination".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This angle between the equator and the place on Earth where the Sun is straight above you is called the "solar declination".

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis不+inclined[[adj.倾向于,赞成的]]不兜摹鷄dj.不愿意的
incline[v.倾斜;偏向]+ed……的→adj.倾向于,赞成的
clin床+ic医学有关→n.门诊部, 临床
decline[v.倾斜;衰退]+ation表名词→n.衰退;下倾
in进入+clin倾斜,斜坡+e→进入斜→偏向,喜爱
